title: Is there any chance for the ink in ink tank printers to dry up? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think the only way to avoid having it dry up is to use it frequently. They are pretty much like regular inkjet printers in that sense. Ink tanks may be a bit less expensive than ink cartridge printers, but I will take a laser printer any day. I have never had toner “go bad” on me. Other than very special high end art printers, and photo printing, I don’t see why inkjet printers are in use AT ALL anymore. Producing the ink is a great money maker for the companies, but laser printing is cheaper in the long run for consumers. (I guess that is the real answer. Most people don’t think more than 2 weeks out.)

Yes, even if you don’t print, run a print every week to push the almost dry ink through. All cartridges can be recharges buy you. I f you want to pay highway printer company robbery keep buying their cartridges. Recharging and buying clones is your best bet. For further information send me an email.
